item.title: Super Mario Bros. Scenes Now Available On Nintendo Alarmo
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/super-mario-bros-scenes-now-available-on-nintendo-alarmo/1100-6530008/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

There's a hot new machine from Nintendo that everybody's talking about that just received a major update, and you know we don't mean the Switch 2. Yes, Nintendo's motion-activated alarm clock got a free update recently that adds scenes from the original NES Super Mario Bros. to the proceedings.

According to the social media post announcing the move, you can receive these new scenes by connecting your Alarmo to the internet and linking it to your Nintendo Account. These scenes are the first from a retro Nintendo game, as the rest of those with scenes featured are all on the Switch. Those games include Super Mario Odyssey, The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Splatoon 3, Pikmin 4, and Ring Fit Adventure. Connecting your Nintendo account will also give you access to scenes from Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and Animal Crossing: New Horizons.

Retailing for $100, the Alarmo is a motion-activated alarm clock with sleep tracking features. It offers a variety of alarms, including "Gentle," which keeps the tone at one set volume, and "Steady," which makes the alarm increasingly louder. The Alarmo does not interact with other Nintendo devices and is not a limited-time or limited-edition product, unlike some other Nintendo devices from over the years.

In other Nintendo news, the company the much-anticipated Switch 2 back in January. A Nintendo Direct that will presumably answer many questions about the new console, such as when it will be released, will be held on April 2.

item.title: Light Your Room With These Retro Dragon Quest 3 Pixelights
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/light-your-room-with-these-retro-dragon-quest-3-pixelights/1100-6529998/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Square Enix released Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake last year, offering a modern way to relive the iconic RPG. The company is now gearing up to launch a series of Dragon Quest 3 Pixelights on September 24, all four of which are now available for preorder. These official Square Enix products offer a unique way to illuminate your game room, each based on the likeness of various characters from the original NES version of the classic RPG.

Each Pixelight requires three AAA batteries, so consider picking up the affordable Amazon Basics AAA Battery Pack (36-Count) for just $13.82. They come with a 10-year shelf life and should be good for all your electronics beyond these Pixelights.

If you’ve yet to play Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake, it's on sale at Amazon. The Xbox Series X version is the cheapest at $46.54 (was $60), though there are also nice discounts for Switch and PS5.

Beyond the Pixelights, there are a few other Dragon Quest items for fans to check out. The Dragon Quest Illustrations: 30th Anniversary hardcover book is on sale for $20 (was $35), and since it’s packed with 240 pages of illustrations and designs, it’s a cool way to go behind the scenes. There’s also a Dragon Quest X Tarot Card Pack with 22 large Arcana cards, each featuring colorful artwork from the series. Typically sold for $26.65, the pack is discounted to $20.47.

item.title: God Of War's 20th Anniversary Event Will Have Donuts And Beach Towels, But No New Announcements
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/god-of-wars-20th-anniversary-event-will-have-donuts-and-beach-towels-but-no-new-announcements/1100-6530004/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Sony Santa Monica and Gallery Nucleus are collaborating on an exhibition to celebrate God of War's 20th anniversary later this month, but don't expect any new announcements.

"With such a stellar lineup and all the anticipation we’ve seen around the anniversary, we do want to be clear that there are no planned announcements for this event," Sony Santa Monica clarified on Twitter.

The exhibition runs between March 15-23, with a panel cast and game dev taking place on March 15 and 22. While there won't be any new announcements, attendees will be able to check out and grab limited edition prints, Phantasy Arcade Cabinets, God of War-themed donuts from Moonbridge, and a Kratos beach towel.

Sony Santa Monica has been silent on what it's been working on since it launched God of War Ragnarok in 2022. However, the studio is reportedly working on its first new IP since the debut of God of War back in 2005.

There are rumors that the games in the original God of War trilogy are being remastered and that the reveal would occur around the franchise's anniversary, but Sony has now confirmed that there won't be any planned announcements during the exhibition. However, it's possible that there could be announcements outside of the event.

Bluepoint Games, the studio behind the Demon's Souls remake, was also reportedly working on a God of War live-service game that was ultimately canceled.
